classes.title: CBIO400
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Medical Simulation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This entry-level medical simulation course focuses on understanding the integration of simulation technology into clinical education, patient safety, and research applications to include the teamwork and communication skills related to these applications.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CBIO423
classes.subtitle: Developmental Toxicology and Teratology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This entry-level medical simulation course focuses on understanding the integration of simulation technology into clinical education, patient safety, and research applications to include the teamwork and communication skills related to these applications.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CBIO423
classes.subtitle: Developmental Toxicology and Teratology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Emphasizes topics of current research interest relative to the genesis of environmentally caused and genetically based birth defects. One two-hour session per week (evening).Grading status: Letter gradeSame as: TOXC�423.
